subject: Self Care
title: The Infinite Scroll
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Infinite Scroll.

hook.text: Before infinite scroll, feeds had pages. You'd reach the end and stop. Removing the end removed your exit cue.

buildup.text: Aza Raskin invented infinite scroll and later called it one of his biggest regrets. It eliminated natural stopping points.

discovery.text: Without stopping cues, the brain enters a state of passive consumption. Time perception distorts and hours vanish.

twist.text: The solution is to create artificial stopping points: set a timer, use app limits, or leave your phone in another room.

climax.text: Before opening any feed, decide how long you'll stay. Set the timer. When it rings, close the app without debate.

punchline.text: Infinite feeds have no end. Create your own exit point.

quiz.question: Why is infinite scroll so effective at keeping users engaged?
options: It removes natural stopping points so users never reach an end
